intro: Neomphalea papuana, commonly known as the Papuan neomphalea, is a species of flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, fragrant flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats within tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
